subject: Re: [junit] JUnit - httpunit vs htmlunit
msgSnippet: ... I prefer HtmlUnit, but apparently HttpUnit has become more like HtmlUnit in the past two years. Since HttpUnit has a more active maintainer than HtmlUnit,
messageBody:
thecyriuz82 wrote:
> Hi everybody,
>
> I'm new with JUnit and try to test my websites with one of the tools
> like httpunit or htmlunit. But unfortunately I don't really know
> which of them is better for testing?
> Can anybody tell me where are the main differences and in which case
> I should prefer one of this tools?

I prefer HtmlUnit, but apparently HttpUnit has become more like HtmlUnit
in the past two years. Since HttpUnit has a more active maintainer than
HtmlUnit, I would probably start there. If you begin to dislike
HttpUnit, then try HtmlUnit. After you've tried both, make your decision.

Good luck.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
